references.paper_title: Probabilistic Reasoning in Intelligent Systems: Networks of Plausible Inference
references.reason: This foundational work in probabilistic reasoning and Bayesian networks underpins the theoretical basis for many causal discovery algorithms, including those discussed in the paper.

references.paper_title: Local causal and Markov blanket induction for causal discovery and feature selection for classification part i: Analysis and extensions
references.reason: This paper introduces the concept of Markov blankets which is fundamental to the problem of time-series variable selection addressed in the paper.

references.paper_title: Extending greedy feature selection algorithms to multiple solutions
references.reason: This paper directly addresses the problem of multiple solutions in feature selection, a key concept extended and applied to time series in this work.

references.paper_title: Algorithms for Discovery of Multiple Markov Boundaries
references.reason: This paper presents algorithms for discovering multiple Markov boundaries in non-temporal data, which the current work adapts and extends to time series.
This paper introduces the sparse-group lasso method, a widely used technique for variable selection that serves as a baseline for comparison in evaluating the proposed method.
